clinical_study.brief_title: The Effectiveness of BreatheMAX Breathing Device on Secretion Clearance
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of BreatheMAX Breathing Device on Airway Secretion Clearance in Patients With Ventilatory Dependence

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determined effects of BreatheMAX on secretion clearance.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Three hours before, ten hours after treatment and night-time (02.00-07.00 am.)
primary_outcome.description: Airway mucus secretion was collected for three hours before and ten hours after treatment based on an auditory airway secretion sound and collected again at 02.00-07.00 am.The mucus secretion was collected by sterile suctioning technique via tracheostomy tube without adding any saline or sterile water.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Three hours before and after treatment
primary_outcome.description: The secretion were collected in three hours before and after treatment, It were measured viscosity by First The mucus was gently homogenized by tissue grinder 5 ml (Cw11-205, Cowie, UK) for six minute at 37 degree celsius Second using Micro-Oswald viscometers with a capillary diameter of 0.77 mm for viscosity measure at same temperature in each sample(before and after).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, during breathing exercise with device and immediate after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Heart rate was monitored before, during and immediate after breathing exercise with BreatheMAX (6-10 beats/set, 10 set/day and rest between ste for 1 minute)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, during breathing exercise with device and immediate after treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Oxygen saturation was monitored before, during and immediate after breathing exercise with BreatheMAX (6-10 beats/set, 10 set/day and rest between set for 1 minute)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: In rest interval between set (1 minute)
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratory rate was measured by manual for 1 minute before, rest interval between set and immediate after breathing exercise with device (during the patients reconnection mechanical ventilation)

arm_group.description: BreatheMAX breathing device is Water pressure Threshold Bottle. The level of water in the cylinder determines the load for treatment. In the treatment using 20% PNIP (Peak negative inspiratory pressure) was performed with 6-10 breaths/set; 10 set/day

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- One sign of secretion accumulation in bronchi
- Stable cardiopulmonary function
- Good consciousness and good co-operation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Massive hemoptysis
- Pneumothorax (untreated)
